page.title: 03Farming around Debenham (1)
page.content: Twenty-five years ago,most farmers in the area kept cattle,sheep and pigs. Arable crops consisted mainly of wheat and barley.The change to more corn crops,accelerated by entry into the EEC, led to a decline in livestock. Now,only one farmer in the area keeps pigs and only one has sheep.This farmer,renowned for his skill with pedigree Suffolks and a national judge of sheep, is unlikely to part with his flock. Ten years ago,there were three large herds of dairy cattle in the area. Because of over-production of milk, farmers who disposed of their herds were offered compensation.The herds disappeared almost overnight. The result was that the last areas of pasture,some undisturbed since medieval times,went under the plough. Plant and insect species were reduced.
